title.value: Evaluation of a prenatal screening decision aid: A mixed methods pilot study
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned in the paper.
title.quote: Evaluation of a prenatal screening decision aid: A mixed methods pilot study

extractions.description: This paper discusses the development and evaluation of a decision aid (DA) to help pregnant women and their partners make informed decisions about prenatal screening for trisomy. It is a mixed-methods pilot study evaluating the usefulness and acceptability of the DA among end-users in Quebec City prenatal care settings.

type.justification: The paper involves a pilot study involving recruitment of participants and empirical evaluation of a decision aid.
type.quote: Methods: In this mixed-methods pilot study, we recruited participants in three prenatal care settings in Quebec City.

name.justification: The focus is on evaluating a decision aid for prenatal screening, which falls under healthcare decision making.
name.quote: We developed a decision aid (DA) to help pregnant women and their partners make informed decisions about prenatal screening for trisomy.

name.justification: The study specifically targets prenatal screening decision-making.
The paper emphasizes shared decision-making in prenatal screening between women and their partners.
name.quote: Shared decision making and Knowledge Translation, Laval University.
